user-story.i-want: to manage sensitive account settings like DSAR requests
user-story.so-that: I maintain control over my personal data and compliance obligations.

acceptance-criteria.criterion: Account settings tab offers DSAR export, DSAR deletion, session revocation, and trusted device list management with confirmation dialogues. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-3.md#implementation-guide]
DSAR export generates downloadable package within 24 hours and surfaces status/progress in UI with polling. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-3.md#dsar-data-export]

Account deletion workflow anonymizes profile, revokes tokens, deletes media, and queues background cleanup while providing final confirmation screens. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-3.md#implementation-guide]
**SECURITY CRITICAL**: All DSAR and deletion actions require re-authentication (OTP) if last auth > 10 minutes. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-3.md#error-recovery]
Audit events recorded for DSAR export/deletion and account closure, notifying compliance team via `audit.profile` stream. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-3.md#security-monitoring]

task.description: Extend `profile_page.dart` with Account tab containing DSAR/closure actions and status banners.
Add OTP confirmation modal triggered before DSAR/deletion requests when session age criteria met.
Implement polling for DSAR export status via `dsar_export_polling_cubit.dart`.
Update `profile_endpoint.dart` with `/dsar/export`, `/dsar/delete`, and `/account/close` endpoints plus OTP validation hook.
Implement `ProfileDSARService` orchestrating export packaging, storage, and retention policy.
Ensure `deleteUserData` workflow cascades deletes across profile, privacy, notification, media, and sessions tables with audit logging.
Configure retention job to purge DSAR export bundles after `DSAR_EXPORT_RETENTION_DAYS`.
Wire audit stream to compliance Slack channel via AWS EventBridge rule `audit-profile-to-slack`.
